title: RetiredCoder
author: RetiredCoder
content: Guys, I'm bored today again, so let's have some fun: a mini-puzzle for puzzle #125.The key fell and shattered into 12 pieces:804E09771C5225AC96033B7F0E46BB48The order of the pieces is unknown, assemble the key back together!There is about 500$ in BCH there, so hurry up!And thanks to creator of original puzzles (Satoshi??) for a lot of fun!PS. No BS here please, I will remove it.PPS. For history, previous mini-puzzle is here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5513047

comments.author: iceland2k14
comments.body: Thank you @RetiredCoder for the mini Puzzle.Got it through the slowest crappy code.....Code:import secp256k1 as icetarget = '1PXAyUB8ZoH3WD8n5zoAthYjN15yN5CVq5'dd = ['804', 'E09', '77', '225', 'AC', '960', '33B', '7F0', 'E4', '6BB', '48']p = '1C5'inc = 0for i in permutations(dd):Â  Â  pvk = int(p + ''.join(i), 16)Â  Â  addr = ice.privatekey_to_address(0, True, pvk)Â  Â  if addr == target:Â  Â  Â  Â  print(f'== Key is Found ==\n {hex(pvk)}')Â  Â  Â  Â  print(f'{ice.btc_pvk_to_wif(pvk)}')

comments.author: RetiredCoder
comments.body: Quote from: iceland2k14 on November 14, 2024, 03:45:33 PMThank you @RetiredCoder for the mini Puzzle.Got it through the slowest crappy code.....Code:import secp256k1 as icetarget = '1PXAyUB8ZoH3WD8n5zoAthYjN15yN5CVq5'dd = ['804', 'E09', '77', '225', 'AC', '960', '33B', '7F0', 'E4', '6BB', '48']p = '1C5'inc = 0for i in permutations(dd):Â Â  Â pvk = int(p + ''.join(i), 16)Â Â  Â addr = ice.privatekey_to_address(0, True, pvk)Â Â  Â if addr == target:Â Â  Â  Â  Â print(f'== Key is Found ==\n {hex(pvk)}')Â Â  Â  Â  Â print(f'{ice.btc_pvk_to_wif(pvk)}')Nice, at first glance the difficulty looks like 12! but since we know that the key must start with "1", the difficulty reduces to 11! only.

comments.author: albert0bsd
comments.body: Congrats @iceland2k14Â    I was working at that hours so I missed it.@RetiredCoder Thanks for release the key, if you want more competition you should announce the date and hour for this. I expect be ready for the #130 key.Regards!

comments.author: AbadomRSZ
comments.body: Quote from: RetiredCoder on November 14, 2024, 01:45:25 PMGuys, I'm bored today again, so let's have some fun: a mini-puzzle for puzzle #125.The key fell and shattered into 12 pieces:804E09771C5225AC96033B7F0E46BB48The order of the pieces is unknown, assemble the key back together!There is about 500$ in BCH there, so hurry up!And thanks to creator of original puzzles (Satoshi??) for a lot of fun!PS. No BS here please, I will remove it.PPS. For history, previous mini-puzzle is here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5513047What an easy puzzle you should have mixed all the letters and numbers. Embarrass yourself and learn how to do a more difficult puzzle. Otherwise, just take the private key and throw it here. The first person to see the post can take this shop to buy bread.0x1c533b6bb7f0804e09960225e44877acKwDiBf89QgGbjEhKnhXJuH7Nbdz1FhKePEPcr4to6PqoSc6KxQy6

comments.author: zahid888
comments.body: Code:import secp256k1 as icefrom itertools import permutationstarget = '0233709eb11e0d4439a729f21c2c443dedb727528229713f0065721ba8fa46f00e'dd = ['804', 'E09', '77', '225', 'AC', '960', '33B', '7F0', 'E4', '6BB', '48']p = '1C5'for i in permutations(dd):Â  Â  pvk = int(p + ''.join(i), 16)Â  Â  pub = ice.scalar_multiplication(pvk)Â  Â  addrpub = pub.hex()Â  Â  addr = ice.to_cpub(addrpub)Â  Â  if addr == target:Â  Â  Â  Â  print(f'== Key is Found ==\n {hex(pvk)}')Â  Â  Â  Â  print(f'{ice.btc_pvk_to_wif(pvk)}')Â  Â  Â  Â  breakFor a faster response... ðŸ‘†Iâ€™ve been monitoring Retired Coder's latest posts for the past two days. Today, Iâ€™m going somewhere, and this happened. Feeling so sad ðŸ˜¢. Anyway, congratulations to the winner!

The first person to see the post can take this shop to buy bread.0x1c533b6bb7f0804e09960225e44877acKwDiBf89QgGbjEhKnhXJuH7Nbdz1FhKePEPcr4to6PqoSc6KxQy6If it was so simple, then why you lose?

comments.author: albert0bsd
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinBarrel on November 14, 2024, 10:29:03 PMIf it was so simple, then why you lose?I agree that the puzzle was simple, Maybe @AbadomRSZ was also AFK when @RetiredCoder publish it.

comments.author: RetiredCoder
comments.body: These are mini-puzzles, I want them to be easy so everyone with minimal skills can solve it.If you want hard puzzles - you already have #67 and #135Â  So, congrats to the winner, done!
